There is a lot of dialogue I'm reading here that concerns me. Specifically, the dialogue maintaining the "us vs them" mentality between the Democrats and the Republicans.
Lets be clear, neither side is "evil" and no one has everything right. Both sides have perspectives and backgrounds from which they hail. Granted, I'm a Democrat but that doesn't mean that my Republican friends are awful, and that I disagree with everything that they think.
Lets keep civil heads on our shoulders, and avoid the "us vs them" mentality.

So I'm brand new to investing but have no real idea of where to even start. I make enough currently to have an extra $200/month I would like to start investing. First I suppose I'll answer all the questions above:
I'm 31 Years Old I'm employed full time and make $25k/yr with a VA Stipend of $834/month. I would like to build retirement savings. My risk tolerance would be roughly 50/50. I have no holdings currently. My only asset would be my vehicle valued at about $4k. My time horizon would be needing the money in the next 15-20 years. I am still working off some debts (Yes I realize that paying off all existing debts comes first). No other relevant financial information that I can think of.
Any advice on where to start or even things to read to educate myself on how to invest intelligently would be fantastic.

True, being relaxed mentally is a good way to actually win more games. Best advice I've ever been given when playing this game was, "When you've lost a few in a row, just stand up and go do something else".

The only problem is that there is a large portion of the LoL community that plays nothing but normals, so for them that is the game. So on the flip side of this when people who play a lot of ranked come into a normal game and just screw around with the reasoning of "its just a normal" it can piss a lot of people off.
Focusing on winning is the goal of any game, fun is the effect you're after as a result of playing the game. If you were to lose all your games in normal, you wouldn't be having fun I can almost guarantee.

WRITING.TITLE: This sign speaks nothing but the truth!

WRITING.TEXT: Saying that a remake should be as close to the original as possible would make creating the remake kind of silly wouldn't it? The whole idea behind the remakes is to appeal to new audiences while keeping as much of the original as possible; they wouldn't make new ones if all they did was appeal to the same fan base.

There are still great moral lessons and tales to be told through the new series of Star Trek. I lament a few of the things missing from the original series as well, but I embrace change and enjoy the new series too. Enjoy it for what it is, entertainment.

Star Trek fans of old miss the intellectual side of Star Trek and while I sort of miss it too, this reboot does great justice to the series. Stop lamenting and whining about the differences between the old and the new and focus more on what has changed for the better. Think of the new Star Trek movies as the same universe with a different retelling of the story *cough cough different timeline*
I'm usually not the one to say this but... repost. Seriously this was on the front page 12 hours ago, you couldn't wait one day?
That was the point in writing Speaker for the Dead as a sequel, I'm pretty sure Orson Scott Card meant for that sentiment to arise.
I'll give that to you, I guess I just don't see any connections between those two stories beyond the title.
Relating two books based on the fact that they have a similar title is... well to be blunt, stupid. Just sayin'...

Really, in the end I enjoyed this cosplay for a couple of reasons. First, this is /r/cosplaygirls and lets be honest, most of us come here to see some skin. Second, she loves cosplay and anime which is awesome and apparent from her profile. Finally, I don't pick apart someone's cosplay because they don't fit my image of the character.
I'll leave this thread with a thumbs up to the cosplayer, and tell everyone else to lighten up, its cosplay and meant to be enjoyed, not judged.

*shrugs* Cosplay is about whatever the wearer wants it to be. Its a fun experience whether its building the costume, the attention you get from it, or actually trying to "be" the character. In the end, its all for personal enjoyment and judging someone because they don't fit someone else's opinion of what Cosplay may or may not be, is a dick move.

I will also submit for your "approval" this
Purpose [edit]
The cosplayer's purpose may generally be sorted into one of three categories, or a combination of the three. Most cosplayers draw characteristics from all three categories: The first is to express adoration for a character, or in feeling similar to a character in personality, seeking to become that character. This type of cosplayer may be associated with being a fan and is often labeled as an otaku. Other characteristics may be an enthusiastic manner and less attention to detail and quality. Such cosplayers are also most likely to adopt the character's personality and are known to criticise other cosplayers for not having a full knowledge of their character, or not also adopting character mannerisms.
The second is those people who enjoy the attention that cosplaying a certain character brings. Within the cultures of anime and manga specifically, as well as science fiction and fantasy, there is a certain level of notoriety that is attached to cosplayers. Such cosplayers are usually characterised by attention to detail in their garments and their choice of popular characters. They are also noted by participation in cosplay competitions.
The third is those who enjoy the creative process, and the sense of personal achievement upon completion. Such people are more likely to have a greater budget dedicated to the project, more complicated and better quality outfits with access to more materials. They are also more likely to engage with professional photographers and cosplay photographers to take high quality images of the cosplayer in their garment posing as the character.

No, the point of cosplay is to dress up like a character from something because its fun, end of story. You can argue this all you want but in reality you're just being a pretentious, internet dick by over analyzing a cosplay.
The fact that you referenced Hunger Games to try and relate to Ender's game makes me really really sad...

To all of you over analyzing this for its "over sexualization"... get over yourself. She's portraying a character, in a sexy way. Enjoy it for what it is and stop over analyzing it. I've seen all of Eva, and honestly I could care less if she doesn't "capture" the essence of Asuka. She's not an actor, she's a cosplayer, stfu.

WRITING.TITLE: [Discussion] Thank you everyone
WRITING.TEXT:
I just wanted to let this sub know that not only have I immensely enjoyed gifting people things, the small gifts that have recently been gifted to me have helped me through my long weeks.
I am a full time employee with the State and I've just recently gone back to school full time to finish out my undergraduate degree that I failed to get before enlisting in the USAF. Being that I have absolutely no free time and am constantly busy the small acts of kindness this sub has shown me brightens my day and makes me smile.
So thank you RAoA! You are all awesome!

WRITING.TITLE: He said, "Paint me like your French girls"

WRITING.TEXT: Agreed, Statikk Shiv is superior to PD.

So far I have managed to carry myself from Silver III to Silver I using nothing but GP Top. My build is Philo Stone - Boots I - Avarice Blade - Boots II - Statikk Shiv - Icebourne Gauntlet - Warmogs - BotRK
Using this its almost impossible to be countered in lane as if you can't win the harass war you just farm with Parley combined with GP10 items and quints and you still farm money. Even if the enemy stacks armor against you in lane generally by the time I make it to my Statikk Shiv they underestimate that 100 magic dmg that it procs.
In most cases so far by mid game I'm a terror that peels well, ults all over the map as needed, and can rush through a team to the carry or soak large amounts of dmg for the team.
This is simply how I've been playing him and its worked for me.

I feel for you silverblaze92! Until recently (just over 2 months now) I was single and had been for over 3 years after I filed for divorce.
I met my current SO through a mutual friend and we all went to see Skyfall together. Being the oblivious and socially inept individual I am I failed to notice the signs and didn't even ask for her number after the movie. My friend being a bit more perceptive, called me the next day and said, "Here's her number, you should call her". The rest, as they say, is history.
I know how hard it is to put yourself out there so upvotes to you sir for making the effort!

I was a Methodist while I was growing up, but over time lost my faith in any organized religion. Before massive amounts of information and peers were available via the internet I had to figure out where I stood on this subject on my own. I'm sure a lot of people can relate to this and it being a bit more difficult to figure out one's faith before the "nets".
I'm respectful of anyone's religion (SO is a devout Catholic) the only thing I ever ask is to be respectful of my beliefs(or lack thereof) and not try and shove it down my throat.

Haha growing up and through high school it kind of sucked. But since growing older (never grew up, I'm a toys R us kid) I kind of revel in it. I make asian stereotype jokes all the time with my friends and they think its a riot that I can laugh at myself.

Hmm well I ended up at an Army base and a Marine base in Iraq and Afghanistan respectively so if we do I didn't see them :-P

WRITING.TITLE: [Intro] Hello from the great state of Montana!
WRITING.TEXT:
Greetings everyone! I found my way here from redditgifts and this seems like a fantastic community so far! I'm 28M, live in the beautiful state of Montana and will be browsing for the first person that I can give to ;-)
Edit: HOLY COW So many fellow Montuckians here!
Edit: Here is a picture of my cats for anyone curious! Thor(Top) and Loki (Bottom) http://i.imgur.com/xxdRAa9.jpg
This is incredible! I just found this subreddit today and after a little bit of browsing, find it to be a fantastic community! :-D
Seriously, I started with the Percy Jackson novels and they were highly entertaining. I then moved to the Kane Chronicles which are a bit more adult but still quite the fun ride!

The last series of books that I read was the Kane Chronicles by Rick Riordan. Honestly, I was a bit skeptical of his writing seeing as its meant for young adults but I found that I really enjoyed the stories and the way he managed to meld in mythology with fiction. I highly recommend them!

I did notice that and your math is quite solid. My only question would be to see the same math done with levels of AP beyond 200. 200 AP is more of a mid game level and you're wrong that enemy resistance always increases as the game continues. At lv 16-18 end game most players won't have built much if any resistance or will just be getting to their singular defensive item if they're not a tank. AP levels will also be much higher than the calculated 200AP.
Please don't misunderstand I'm not saying you're wrong, and as you saw in my last reply I will be using void staff in all early/mid game situations based on this post :-D.
So awesome!

WRITING.TITLE: Teemo and Liandry's Tormet
WRITING.TEXT: Someone please correct me if I'm wrong but why doesn't Teemo's poison proc this effect? Both his shrooms and blinding dart do, so I'm confused.

I'm still on the fence about the early elo gain/losses. Its taken me almost a month to work my way back up to almost 1400 after having a rough string of matches in which I had a troll or leaver ruin my game.
I suppose the reasoning for the huge losses and gains it to quickly assess what level play you should be at. If you get completely stomped in one game it drops you down quickly to try and better match you, while if you dominate your next one it jumps you up a bit to again try and match you appropriately.
There are enough complaints going around about the matchmaking as it is. If opposing teams were allowed to see boarders it would only further this furor.

Must like what a lot of the people here have already said, Teemo is mainly a counter to certain champions. However, this said, he can be a solid carry from low elo (1200 to around 1400) due to his ability to very effectively split push and provide map awareness through shrooms.
The S3 items also lend themselves quite well to this giving him the ability to not only bully but completely dominate his lane in early/mid game. Malady, Liandris, and Void Staff give him the punch to make many champions think twice about engaging him and add his already high base speed with flash and he can escape most ganks.
TL;DR: Teemo is mainly a counter champ, but can carry from low to mid elo with split push.
Ah thank you for the clarification this makes much more sense to me. On a side note I shall begin trying this out on Kayle and Teemo early builds :-)

Correct me if I'm wrong but wouldn't these calculations only hold true at early/early mid game AP levels? Being that DC is a % based increase to AP wouldn't higher end game levels bear different numbers based on having over 400AP through itemization?
One can only hope that somewhere in this expansion we hear an, "Ohhh my..."
Well that escalated and disappeared quickly.
Give him karma so we can find out what happens next!

I have no idea how my gear stacks up now, but I'm looking for a friendly group to help me re-learn the ropes and perhaps see some end game content.

I'm not going to the Billings show but I'll be driving to the Spokane show on the 10th. I'll be sure to take pictures and post. For reference its the same distance to Spokane as it is to Billings for me since I live in Helena.
Honestly I don't know. I'll be curious to see just how well the Griz do this season. I do think that it was good that things finally came to light with them over the off season though.

WRITING.TEXT: I could possible be persuaded to drive to Billings from Helena for this

I'm here to say two things. First you seem like an incredibly awesome individual (4 languages excluding English??? WOW!). Second, there is some debate over whether larger cats can purr since we don't know exactly what the mechanism is when cats purr.
Generally though larger cats "chuff" or friendly growl instead of the standard purr noise. Some scientists have theorized that the larger cats would be purring but due to their size it comes out as a "chuff" instead.
*Edit for spelling

I'm also a new rider with about 2 months on my Ninja 250r and this subreddit has been super helpful for me. It helped me make the decision to buy the bike I did, and I've received great feedback on pictures I've posted of where I've gone here in MT.
Thanks for taking the time for this subreddit, I enjoy hanging out here.

I am a Korean adopted male with an adopted younger sister, and while growing up I don't ever remember her dating an Asian guy. Honestly I still don't think she has ever dated an Asian guy, she is always with a white male.
My sister is not racist in any way, shape or form, but I've always wondered why she's never dated another Asian. Part of the reason may be that we grew up in Montana where the population of Asians is smaller at best, but when she went to Hawaii for college, she still never did.
I've never asked her what the reason for this might be, but perhaps I will now this post has me thinking about it.

WRITING.TITLE: [27M4F] Asian in MT looking to meet some new people!
WRITING.TEXT:
Well as the title says I'm 27, Asian, and living in MT. I'm 5'8", brown eyes, with the typical Asian build.
I left college in my junior year to enlist in the USAF and spent four years having a great time. Upon separation in 2010 I moved back to my hometown for financial and family support reasons. Now that I'm back I've been disgusted and disappointed with trying to meet/date people here.
I'm not necessarily looking for a relationship, but I'm open to wherever things lead to. Don't care how far away you are (accents are awesome) PM if you're interested in chatting!
An upvote for you as well Thracks!
